website_summaries.verdict: With a design that’s virtually escape-proof, you can count on this coat staying put while keeping your dog dry and toasty. Ideal for active dogs.
pros: A waist buckle fastener and back leg loops ensure that this coat stays in place
Enhances thermal insulation to help keep dogs warm
Houndtex coating delivers excellent water-resistance without sacrificing airiness
Features harness openings and a reflective lining
cons: Rear leg straps are awkwardly positioned

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, versatile coat.
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I love it, but my dog loves it. And she hates coats. I bought this to summit Mt Washington with my dog. It was 24F at the top with 50+mph winds and my girl did great with this coat. It also makes it easy to pair with a base layer if your dog (like mine) has very thin coat and no fat.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: but it's perfect. A high quality jacket well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Received the jacket quickly. I have a pitbull with a deep chest and narrow waist. Originally I was concerned about proper fit, but it's perfect. A high quality jacket well worth the price. My cat loved the cardboard box as well
customer_reviews.author: brian bradley

customer_reviews.title: Love this parka!
customer_reviews.text: I could have gone with either the 26" or the 28", I choose the 28" in hopes that the back leg loops would be a better fit. Perfect decision! The 26" would have resulted in the negative reviews that said the "back loops are worthless". The coat's back can be shortened by the draw cord, leaving the sides a perfect fit! I wasn't sure how the pup would react to having a coat on for the first time, he wagged his tail, strutted around a bit and jumped on the couch and happily curled up like he was snuggled in a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Sizing was difficult to determine
customer_reviews.text: I was torn about whether to get the 26inch or 28inch. I have a 75lbs Malinois who technically measures 28inches from shoulder blades to root of his tail.. but then I went with my gut and got the 26inch instead. Lucky me, because the size fits perfectly and he even still has an inch of room (there is a cinch mechanism on the tail end that gives you some wiggle room). So if your pup is between two sizes, I would go with one size down. Other than the sizing issue, the coat is awesome quality! Definitely stoked to have my pup wear this during the cold Minnesota winters :)
customer_reviews.author: Carina F.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fit and coverage
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want velcro, as it ends up snagging on something and collecting lint and dog hair. This single belt buckle is relatively easy to put on (wrap around the dog's waist and click) and exactly what I was looking for. Besides the attachment method, I was also looking for belly coverage - pits have good bit of keel with little fur, and this coat provides precisely the coverage they need while fitting their wonky body shapes (I have three of different proportions). I also really like the adjustability for the inbetween sizes, and have taken advantage of it for my dogs' fit. HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tlvan

customer_reviews.title: nice construction but my dog is hard to fit. Hurtta is a good company.
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved a hood as part of the neck gaiter. For my dog the neck gaiter is short in length, more like a collar. the length could be longer for the back but it will do. no tail. The armpit area could be more enclosed. The black material is rough & flimsy. Would have thought it would be more like neoprene . The bib covers the front but it is narrow between the front legs. It measured 3", my dog needs 4". Would have liked a nice wide cover on the girth like on the U only You dog coat.(that coat was small also) My dog is a Dobermann, 112#. I might have to go custom.
customer_reviews.author: Miramoja

customer_reviews.title: Cozy Option for Pitbulls
customer_reviews.text: As a pitbull owner, it is SO challenging to find coats for my dog as she has a larger chest but isn't bulky otherwise. None of the pet store jackets fit her. This jacket fits like a glove and is so soft and warm. She doesn't mind me putting it on her at all. As for the "strap" part around the waist, it runs a little on the snug side if you have a larger dog, so order on the bigger side when it comes to sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Love Hurtta jackets
customer_reviews.text: Love this coat. For starters, it's super cute. I bought it for my guy cuz he was freezing at night when we'd go winter camping. This is perfect - It covers his haunches. It's soft. It's warm. Looks and feels comfy. Fast and easy to get on and off. Sizing seemed a wee big. My last hurtta was 17" and perfect fit. This one is 16" and a little big. However, i think this one's style is supposed to be on the loose fitting side; plus, it has elastic tighteners so it can be adjusted to fit. Well made. This is our second hurtta. Love em both. Cost more but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: A very well made, light-weight coat.
customer_reviews.text: A very good coat for my GSD. I recommend the coat. 1. Light weight: easily fit in my dog’ pack while back packing. 2. Well made with good coverage. It covered the dog’s neck, chest and rear well and yet, it was easy for the dog to run and move in. 3. Moderately warm: great for cool weather with light rain or drizzle. I would not use it as a substitute for some form of blanket while sleeping in really cold weather though. 4. Waterproof: handled light rain and drizzle. Have not had it out in a down pour. 5. Easy to put on: It slips over my dog’s head and bucked in place in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Woods

customer_reviews.title: One star with an explanation.
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on the fit or anything other than the color. I ordered the "Cherry" for my 90 lb. boy. In the picture, it looks very red and when I think of cherries, Maraschino cherries are a very bright red (I took my bottle out of the refrigerator for verification), and fresh cherries are dark red. What they call "Cherry" in this coat is a very bright pink. The proper name for that shade, I believe, is magenta. My husband, who walks our dog, took one look at it and said there was no way he was going to leave the house with our dog wearing that pink coat. So there, it's going back. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Finland design. Functional. Fit. Foxhound-tested and approved.
customer_reviews.text: Very high-drive foxhound mix sized using detailed measurements. Only one complaint: The elastic rear straps are uncomfortable for her where they meet at the junction of her genitalia. She sits down in protest. Keeping rear section centered requires putting her tail through yellow sizing loop at rear. Polartec liner top-grade but it is a mass of shed after an hour requiring 10-15 minutes of vacuuming. This remains a seriously respectable garment for protection from the elements. Very quick to put on and take off, or adjust for fit. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: oh.leary

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Runs way large.
customer_reviews.text: This coat is heavy duty and probably nicer than my own coat. It definitely runs large though. I returned the coat for a smaller size and its still too big. Cant return again...The 'cherry' color is pink not red. Haven't used it sadly. Plan to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: DLR

customer_reviews.title: Great coat
customer_reviews.text: Very warm coat and great quality. There are a number of different spots you can adjust to fit for size or weather conditions. My shorthair (pointer/whippet mix) really likes it in cold New England winters. She measures 21 inches from base of neck to base of tail, chest is about 30in. I tried the 22 and 20. Because the length is adjustable I went with the 20. At full length it’s just a little past the edge of her rear. If it’s not as cold, I shorten it a little. I would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best. Extremely adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: We love this! My pit mix hates going outside when it gets cold, and her hoodies just weren't cutting it. We strapped this baby on for a walk (in 30-something degree weather) and she didn't want to go back inside! She wanted to sprint, which never happens (she's generally a couch potato)! The sizing is a dream. I got a size or two up from her measurements since she's an odd shape, but it was a pleasant surprise to find out the length, neck circumference (in two places), and chest girth are entirely adjustable. This has given us more freedom during the harsh winters!
customer_reviews.author: R N

customer_reviews.title: Great winter coat
customer_reviews.text: My 11-pound bichon mix has been wearing this coat for the past few weeks, and did very well in the snow. Once you figure out how to put it on, it's quick and easy and keeps most of him warm and dry. I especially like the fact that there is a slot in the back to hook a lead onto a harness.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: At last, a well made doggie jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, nice, thick fleece liner in the inside, and durable softshell on the outside. Really easy to put on and take off. Fully covers my dog, and I imagine would any other dog. Comfortable for my lab mix to wear. I put it on her and let her roam around in the house with it on. She went to her spot on the couch and simply took a nap in it. Protects her belly great which is what I was most concerned about/searching for. Jacket stays put even with all of her rigorous activities. Keeps her dry and warm. Will never order another jacket anywhere else, excellent design!
customer_reviews.author: Ama buyer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Maine winter
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my two short-haired Feist mixes. Every morning around 6, we go trail running or climb a mountain here in Maine. Didn't want to stop because it was getting too cold. These are easy to put on, the dogs don't mind them, and they seem to do the job. The dogs' stamina for romping through the forest when it's 19 degrees definitely increased with these; and it was hard to stop them from doing it even before the coats. Now if I could just stop them from trying to pull up ice chunks and lay in the snow to eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth F.

customer_reviews.title: An ideal dog coat
customer_reviews.text: I searched quite a while before I found this coat, and I'm glad I found it. It covers my pit bull well, and it's not so easy to find a coat which fits a dog with an unusually deep chest and large neck. With this coat, my dog is comfortable in temperatures of 20 F and below, for walks lasting 30 minutes or more. I can't comment on longer walks or day long hikes. By the way, I love the orange color.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Good Design.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a Portuguese Water Dog. Medium size build. So far we have used this on a 2 mile winter hike in the local state park 30F and windy. Our Dog was nice and warm and didn't have any issues with the parka. It is easy to put on and take off and seems to be designed with good durability. After 1 hour of running on the trails he still didn't mind wearing it and he was warm underneath and not damp from too much parka. Parka seems to have good breathability and excellent fit as it to stayed in place the entire hike.
customer_reviews.author: TML

customer_reviews.title: So Warm My Dog from the Tropics Is Comfy at 32F
customer_reviews.text: Spotty is from Thailand, has very thin fur, and needs a coat when it's below 60. I have bought him two previous coats that weren't warm enough for NYC winters. He was warm enough in his Hurtta Summit to enjoy the park at 32. No shivering! It looks a little like he's wearing a sleeping bag, but so what? It is waterproof and very easy to put on and take off. We are satisfied customers.
customer_reviews.author: knits well runs slowly

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: Yay! Finally found a coat that fits! I have tried so many coats for my pup and most are either too big or too small. This coat fits perfect. I have a 47-50 lb pit mix. She’s a “yoga practitioner” pit, muscular but lean muscle as opposed to “bodybuilding muscle.” She’s old (14) and I like to keep her warm when out on our walks. Some things are probably more for me...like the fleece lining...I like that better than nylon. When in need of another dog coat Hurtta will be the first place I look.
customer_reviews.author: K E Harris

customer_reviews.title: Durable, warm, and dry
customer_reviews.text: I live in an area that gets very cold and snowy, and having the right gear means we can get outside! I love this coat for skijoring as the coat can slide over her harness and lead to keep her comfortable before a skijor race starts. Sometimes the temperature is below 0° outside while we wait for a race to start! My dog likes this coat too, and doesn't notice it when we get outside
customer_reviews.author: Checkers

customer_reviews.title: Many sizes for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: I got this in 20" long for my beagle mix at first and it was way too big in the neck so it slid past his shoulders, making it too long too. I exchanged it for 18" thinking it wouldn't be enough of a difference. It was considerably smaller in the neck which held it in place properly. We went on a winter hike, first time he ever wore a jacket, and he accepted it well. It is easy to put on/take off and adjust. It's warm and well made. So glad we gave one size smaller a chance.
customer_reviews.author: vikioviki

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully designed... easy to get good fit
customer_reviews.text: This jacket has allowed me to start snow hiking with my Dalmatian... a guy who loves to hike but is lean and has no undercoat. I had another jacket that still left him shivering if we went too far. Today I had him out for an hour in the woods at 20 degrees, we both loved it. Only problem is that I bought the raspberry color for him... not really a guy color but he doesn't mind at all.
customer_reviews.author: Crescent Reader

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. The design and craftsmanship are superior to most other dog coats I've seen. The coat fits snugly so that it doesn't shift when our dog is running but allows room for him to move freely. I purchased the coat at my vet's recommendation since poochy boy is getting older and spends several hours a day outside. I feel better that he's well covered and he seems to be less inclined to move to the door to go inside now that he has it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: Really Underwhelmed.
customer_reviews.text: While I appreciate the smart details in this jacket, I am extremely disappointed in the fit as well as the lack of insulation. My Terrier needs warmth here in the cold Northeast and currently needs 4 layers under this jacket. And it's only December! This should be called the "Hill" parka, not the Summit! Also, I measured carefully from the withers - as Hurtta suggests - and it's too short! Hoping I can return for a warmer model. So not worth $80!
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: It's a great winter coat for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: The coat has good coverage to block the wind and insulate her( durable cover with a fleece liner ). The first coat( same brand ), is 10 years old and still good shape. This coat keeps my older dog warm while not interfering when she's walking or running around. Only negative I have is the color looks red in the pictures, but is almost flat pink in color in person. Not a deal breaker with my female dog.
customer_reviews.author: Andujar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality coat
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality coat, super durable and warm. My dog manages to find seemingly every thorny bush in a 5 mile radius of my house and I used to be worried about this coat getting snags and holes every time she would start sniffing deeper into some briars but amazingly, it doesn't have a scratch on it yet. Only problem I had was with the elastics to keep coat down around the hind legs. They were very tight and hard to stretch out, and due to some careless ironing on my part while trying to stretch them out, I ended up having to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: ZMT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Finally a waterproof coat that is warm and that actually fits my pup while allowing her complete freedom of movement. I have a hard to fit Tiawan dog and I am so happy to find something that works for her and that also stands up to the ever-changing Pacific Northwest weather!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Warmke

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I frequently take my 45 lb short hair dog backpacking with me and she gets cold at night when the season starts to turn. I originally purchased a $25 jacket from another supplier and she shivered all night. I spent the money to buy this one and expected it to be a significant improvement. It wasn't. She still shivered all night and I had to wrap her in a safety blanket each night. Not worth the money even though did look good on her.
customer_reviews.author: Sydnee Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Nice winter coat would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Really nice winter coat. Fit my whippet due to many adjustable points on the coat. Have been using for a couple months now and holding up well. Keeps tummy warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: RachelH

customer_reviews.title: GREAT material once you get the right fit!
customer_reviews.text: We own a 12 lbs 16inch long miniature dachshund so he’s been tough to fit. So far from the initial impression I’m in love with the quality material, fleecy lining, and quality of the straps and tightening cords. The size 14 swamped him and was far too long. The size 10 was about 3 inches too short on his back and is better for a medium sized chihuahua. *will update once we receive the size 12.*
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Harris

customer_reviews.title: Quality, fit, comfort
customer_reviews.text: My little Chihuahua x French Bulldog is so happy in this coat. It fits well, stays in place, and keeps him toasty in Chicago. Quality and fit are excellent. For reference he is 12.5" back, 14.5" neck, 16.5" chest. I got the size 12. I also bought the Extreme Warmer and planned to keep just one but I will keep both. We haven't reached deep winter yet and this one is perfect for the current thirty degree temps.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I bought two size 22 for my Aussies (both shaved due to medical issues) for this fall and winter. They were between sizes and I guess a I should have sized down because it’s a little bigger than a I would’ve wanted but still fits okay and works great. I’m looking forward to our long winter hikes this year and then still being able to be warm and comfortable in these.
customer_reviews.author: Kacy Marie

customer_reviews.title: It goes on easily, adjusts well for various body shapes (I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Washington State and have a short-haired dog, so a coat that is both waterproof and warm is a must, and this one is definitely worth the cost. It goes on easily, adjusts well for various body shapes (I have a bully breed, so it's hit-and-miss getting something that fits such a stout and beefy frame), and keeps me from worrying about whether or not the dog is too cold whether we're out in the neighborhood or hiking in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine N Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I first bought a raincoat I found on sale and was amazed it fit my barrel-chested lab mix
customer_reviews.text: Though Hurtta products are expensive, they are worth it. I first bought a raincoat I found on sale and was amazed it fit my barrel-chested lab mix. Only thing I needed to improve on was the warmth factor. Found the summit parka and it's perfect. It's well insulated, keeps my pups dry, and fits them well even when they are being active. It adjusts enough to fit my long, lean coonhound and my stocky white lab. As hard as it is for me to spend this much on dog clothing, i'm a convert. haven't found any other jackets that keep my dogs warm and fit well enough to withstand some activity.
customer_reviews.author: kcw

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Parka ......., but
customer_reviews.text: My Doberman loves this parka. The only thing that I really don’t like is the elastic that goes around her rear legs rides up and meets at her nether region and seems it’s a bit restrictive when urinating. Maybe with a little more usage the elastic will stretch and won’t be a problem. I’ll get back to you on that .
customer_reviews.author: R. Santini

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Winter Coat !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coat for my border collie - Kelli. She is a medium sized dog that weighs about 42 lbs. This coat has all the 'bells and whistles' that one who loves their dog might imagine....snug fit all around, rear leg straps so that the coat remains firm around her hind section, small slit on top to allow for leash access to her harness, enough neck coverage without being an cumbersome hoodie, and very stylish reflectors on the sides so that she can be spotted at night. She has had a number of coats over the years, but this one is the all time best! Well worth a few extra $$.
customer_reviews.author: Split Pea

customer_reviews.title: Dry and warm!
customer_reviews.text: What a great jacket- so well made and warm. Ordered the 24” for my long and lean 50lb dog. It was not snug around neck or legs but I didn’t want it to be as I had heard about some jackets causing chaffing on neck. Everything is adjustable. She loves it and can still run top speed through the woods no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but color is different than shown
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail, seems to be made well. Went by the sizing chart and it fits my dog pretty good. Be aware if you buy the color "raven", the straps are yellow, not blue like is shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket! I got this one for pupper that has a ton of fur (corgi mix) and it’s oerfect for a freezing Colorado day. You can tell these coats are MUCH better than the two Velcro strap ones I was buying before. My only complaint is that the butt straps are kind of awkward/seems to shift in seemingly uncomfortable ways, but the coat will flap if you don’t use them. Not a huge deal, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful design providing the warmth my pup needs!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this jacket. The design is fantastic and it's helping to keep my 14 year old Lab warm during this frigid frigid cold. It's really easy to get on and off once you "set it up" for your pup. My biggest issue was figuring out which size was correct for him. He's a longer lab and I was trying to decide between the 28" and the 26". In the end, I kept the 26" as it ended right at the top of his tail. Buy this coat for your pup, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ferrin

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Live this coat! Worth the money for sure! I’ve always gotten cheaper ones for my dogs and finally decided to splurge on a better one. Glad I did!! This one seems to keep him warm and is adjustable at the neck and at the tail so that his upward pointing tail has space but his cheeks are still covered. Waist pet is also very adjustable. I even put it one my smaller dog once and, while a little big, was perfectly usable. Love this!!
customer_reviews.author: Marlo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Defective Strap
customer_reviews.text: The coat looks to be very warm, and I like how it's adjustable. I received a bad coat though with the buckle shown on backwards/upside down. The hard part of the buckle hits my dog's body. To have it buckle correctly, the chest/belly section would have to be twisted. I expected more from Hurrta especially for $85.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and well made
customer_reviews.text: Fits our Belgian Malinois perfectly. The coat is very well made. Easy on and off. Great high neck for super cold, wet or snowy days. Just what he needs for our cold winters!
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage!
customer_reviews.text: My little Shih Tzu is extremely sensitive to cold, and this coat covers more of her than any other coat I've found, including major muscle groups. She has a long neck, and the coat provides coverage right up to her ears. She doesn't like the elastic leg bands, but they keep the coat from shifting to one side or the other. My only regret is that I didn't wait for one of the other colors to become available, as she also has the Hurtta torrent coat (raincoat) in the same cherry color.
customer_reviews.author: Pat A.

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: The coat will be adequate for my small pup when it starts to snow; however, I am quite disappointed that the product I received was not the product in the picture. I got the black goat with the teal straps. The coat I received had yellow straps that I had to modify so that it would actually buckle. Overall, the coat is functional - I just didn't expect to have to put in the work to make it actually clip around my dog and I'm slightly disappointed that the straps are yellow and not blue (surface-level complaint).
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Took a gamble it would fit.. some others wouldn't. I like the clip round the chest vs velcro which tends to come undone. The clip band does tend to slip.. but still better than velcro or zippers imo. Leg loops cool to keep back in place. Nice long collar for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Ease of putting on/off dog. I have a large papillon - 15 lbs. small neck, 16 length base to tail. I purchased a 16. He can wear it, but it runs a little big. However, there are many adjustment strings, etc. for tighter fitting. He could have probably used a 14 or even a 12, but this way I could put a sweater on him, plus jacket for very cold days. I would recommend jacket as it is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Rose

customer_reviews.title: Summit Parka sz 14/35
customer_reviews.text: Good quality coat I ordered a 14 but a 12 would have fit more snug My boy measures long 14 and chest is 17 It seems to run long more in the chest than the length which can be adjusted for back length at the hind The clasp dos not have the lock element like the older version The sleeve opening could be smaller for less air to get in I will use this as a shell jacket over a sweater Overall happy I have 3 other Hurtta coats for my chinese crested hairless boy
customer_reviews.author: wabi sabi

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket! Very adjustable fit (my dog is very hard to fit), protects his belly up to his ears. He’s rolled in the mud, it’s been washed and still looks new. Pictured here in -25F with a sweater underneath, dog was still happily playing outside.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Provides Excellent Warm and Water Resistance
customer_reviews.text: We own a small, 38 pound puppy (love of our live) who simply could not handle the 8 degree temperatures compounded by 5 to 6 inches of snow where we live. This jacket does such a great job of keeping her warm and dry, that she begins to wiggle, wag her tail, and bark excitedly whenever she sees us take the jacket out of the closet. To her, this jacket is a definite sign that she's about to go outside and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Fogel

customer_reviews.title: Love this jacket
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket. It was exactly what I was looking for. High visibility and durable. When you touch the jacket, you can tell it is well-made and made of solid materials. I get compliments about how good-looking the jacket is. It almost seems like materials suited for a human! I don't use the elastic straps in the rear of the jacket as it seems like it would interfere with pooping. Using the one strap is fine. This size fits my 25 pound Standard Schnauzer puppy well and he can definitely grow into it when he is 40 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for Ohio weather
customer_reviews.text: Love this coat for my pup! The chest is a bit adjustable so that's great for pups that are a bit chesty. The buckle on my strap happened to be backwards, so it's twisted when she wears it, but doesnt really seem to affect her.
customer_reviews.author: molly mik

customer_reviews.title: one you get the right size its great
customer_reviews.text: This is the 16" jacket on my 19 lb cockapoo. It took several tries to get the right size based on the sizing chart as he measures length wise for a larger size and adding the suggested 2" made it enormous.... but 3rd time was the charm and its great. We also ordered the long underwear for snowy days to prevent the armpit snowballs!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H

customer_reviews.title: Great coat-wish it was a little more durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought each of my dogs one of these coats in their size. I really like the design of this coat-it keeps their belly warm, it’s got ways to adjust it slightly to make sure the fit is good, and it’s easy to put on and take off. I’m using this as a lighter weight coat for 30-40 degree days. Only complaint is that both coats got tiny rips in the outer layers within the first 2 months of having them. Have never had that issue with other coats. Wish the outer layer was a little more durable for dogs rough housing and random stick pokes in the woods, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far but sizing WAY off
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to durability as pup has only used it once, but it was in cold, windy, and snowy conditions and it kept him warm and dry. I measured pup and ordered size 26 based on size chart, and it was enormous. He ended up needing a 22, and he still has room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: shoespaz

customer_reviews.title: Great Coat
customer_reviews.text: Love this coat. It keeps our pup warm during the New England winter. The red is more on the pink side of the spectrum. Easy to put on and take off. Adjustable fit is nice. My only (very minor) complaint is that our harness has both a front and top loop, but this jacket makes only the top loop accessible. Pupper pulls a little more using the top loop.
customer_reviews.author: daniel bussone

customer_reviews.title: Great coat for Wisconsin winters
customer_reviews.text: Great coat for Wisconsin winters. My dog is the type of dog that loves to sleep under blankets and cuddle up so I know she's not a fan when it is -24 outside. This coat protects great against those harsh winds and snow. I don't use the straps around her back legs, they hang too low and get in her way. So the wind does blow the back up a bit but it's not that bad, you can just lay it down again and its fine.
customer_reviews.author: Col

customer_reviews.title: VERY well made, more for Fall/Spring than Winter in the NE
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, fits great. Quality!! We thought this would be a WINTER jacket, but it's pretty thin. It's beautifully lined in fleece, but probably will need another layer to truly be a Northeast winter jacket ... consider buying on the large size so you can fit a sweater or fleece under if truly cold weather is your focus.
customer_reviews.author: MGW

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for Mini Dachshund
customer_reviews.text: After being so frustrated with Helios dog coats, I tried this brand. And what a perfect fit a size 12 was for our mini doxie. It is lightweight and waterproof. The only thing I wish it had was an attached leash hook. Then it would be absolutely perfect! Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FIT!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is pretty awkwardly proportioned and finding a warm coat that fit well has not been easy. This one is perfect! I love that it covers his whole belly instead of just a strap. It keeps him super warm and doesn't shift around. Love that you can leave the neck loose or tighten it if it's super snowy
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Very nice materials. The 22" Summit parka fits my long ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made/designed. Very nice materials. The 22" Summit parka fits my long and lean 50lb pitbull mix. The neck is a bit wide, but the bungie cord adjusts to fit. The back leg loops are not necessary for casual walking. Easy to put on/off. Perfect for Minnesotan winters.
customer_reviews.author: CharCharBinks

customer_reviews.title: Doberman 32 inch
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Feels warm! Purchased the “32 inch” in color “Raven” for the Hurtta Pet Collection Summit Parka for Dogs. My Doberman chest is very large so needed this size to accommodate his chest. I am able to shorten the length by his tail so it’s not so long.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY AND DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON, HORRIFIC CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: this item should not receive any stars, The jacket is poorly designed and does not stay put on my dog's rear. Te option of the elastic for the hind legs makes it very uncomfortable and she will not walk. A waste of money, do not purchase. This is the first time using it because of a horrible storm, she was not protected. Amazon refuses to let me return it. Very rude customer service and they do not value their customers. I think they think that I cannot go elsewhere with my business and become a valued customer.
customer_reviews.author: Rona M.

customer_reviews.title: Great dog coat!!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Super adjustable, fits both my 54 lb Border Collie and 34 lb Border Collie--because it can be adjusted in a number of ways. The bright color and reflective strips make it easy to see my dog in any light conditions, it's lightweight enough that it doesn't slow her down, and keeps her warm and dry in a wide range of temperatures. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David & Judith

customer_reviews.title: Hurtta Pet Collection Summit Parka for Dogs - Very warm, easy on & off
customer_reviews.text: This coat is so cozy and warm. My dog loves it (the first day didn't but now loves it). Very warm for those below zero days up north. Also so easy to put on and off. I measured my dog at 26 inches long, but that size coat was way too big. The 24-inch coat fits perfect. I like the adjustment around the middle because my dog is long but skinny, and it allows me to cinch it. No worries about the coat sliding off of her as she walks as most coats do.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Quality Dog Parka
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this purchase. My granddog, a chocolate lab, loves her jacket. It provides excellent protection from rain, snow and cold. The fit is perfect due to the large number of sizes it is offered in. The price was great also.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Set for the upcoming winter
customer_reviews.text: Based on his measurements I originally ordered this in a 16 but it was tight so I returned it and ordered the orange for 20.00 less in the 18 and it fit perfect. He’s set for winter.
customer_reviews.author: Jks

customer_reviews.title: Quite honestly, best dog coats
customer_reviews.text: Several dogs over several years through several Northeast winters - I have no shortage of winter gear. Sadly, all other winter coats will be left in the closet (really, will be donated). Honestly, wish I found these sooner. Right now I have two Mini Schnauzers and a Schnoodle - all now have Hurtta. One of my dogs is six months old, one is 14 years old - I've been around the block a few too many times with winter gear for my dogs and these are it. Never been happier with a dog coat.
customer_reviews.author: Gail B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the snow
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well-designed coat. Be careful on sizing. I thought I had the correct measurement, but it was a bit too long. We still use it. It just is not quite as fashionable looking. It does a great job in the snow. It does not get soggy like non-waterproof coated coats.
customer_reviews.author: P. I. M.

customer_reviews.title: Way too thin!
customer_reviews.text: Our winters are VERY cold. I was expecting a warmer jacket for the money. VERY thin material. There is no way this will keep my dog warm! Not worth the money. Sending it back!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is pretty expensive but with all the positive reviews I decided to take the plunge knowing my dog would be getting a pretty warm jacket. My issue isn't with the fit but the material. My dog brushed up against a bare bush and it created tears in the jacket. Really annoyed by that since it's so damn expensive
customer_reviews.author: hey there!

customer_reviews.title: Best fitting winter dog coat!
customer_reviews.text: There's not a jacket that fits my pups as perfect as this! A lot of places to adjust and no velcro to wear out. The only thing I noticed is the cherry color is actually more pink. Thankfully it was for our girl pup.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: This fits my dog well and isn't bulky which makes for easier wear through the mountains And it has snap fasteners not velcro so he won't come out of a bush without it on.
customer_reviews.author: Bev91945

customer_reviews.title: Wisconsin Vizsla Approved
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket!!! I have a 50 lbs. Vizsla that has a narrow, deep chest and this jacket fits perfectly. Make sure to following the easy measuring guide. The jacket does a great job of covering his tummy and provides a lot of coverage. It is not constricting and also fits under his harness really well. This is defiantly puppy approved.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie K.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Warm and Worth every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this coat now for about 3 years and it is still like new. Worth every penny. Easy to put on and take off. Protection from the elements here in Ohio is fantastic. It gets frequent winter use and is still in great condition. Highly recommended for medium to small dogs who get cold and need to stay warm and dry. Or large dogs that tend to get cold or are finicky in bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: The Doberman loves it
customer_reviews.text: Dog loved it, it kept him warm and for a Doberman who gets cold easily it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Casandra

customer_reviews.title: My dog's favorite parka
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this thing. She's an American Staffordshire Terrier mix and gets cold really easily when we're camping. She is visibly excited and willingly lets me put her parka on every night when the sun goes down on a camping trip. I will use it on our winter walks soon too. It's much easier to put on her than the human vest I had been using and some of the other dog clothes out there.
customer_reviews.author: EToTheIzzo

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, dog comfortable, easy to put on/off
customer_reviews.text: Almost Pefect, Highly recommend! Size chart exact. I have a Blue Heeler Australian Cattle Dog, she measured 18inches and chest 25, ordered the 18inch in orange. Great visibility in the woods. So easy to slip on and off. Only problem...there are small rips in the outer fabric after only a week. I’ll have to patch with waterproof repair tape I guess. Perhaps got snagged on brush while hiking. Figured this tough quality fabric would hold up better, especially when paying $80!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Without Question Best Dog Coat
customer_reviews.text: Love the orange since it's so easy to see! The coat is well made and easy to put on multiple times a day for walks. Would never purchase any other brand. Thanks Hurtta!
customer_reviews.author: Barstow

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This products keeps my dogs dry and warm but my poodle always runs away when I go to put it on and I bought 2 and they both got holes in them the 1st day and the reflective tape peeled off the 1st week. I feel theses are not worth the money at all!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: great parka for winter - only 1 negative comment
customer_reviews.text: High quality Parka! I'm located in Quebec - then winter is fairly cold... Fits perfectly my australian cattle dog. The only negative comment is that the hind leg straps are not properly located. I had to cut both and move them widely to let enough space for my dog to be able to p**.
customer_reviews.author: Client d'Amazon

customer_reviews.title: nice coat runs large order a size down so I gave it 4 stars since I had to return it
customer_reviews.text: My dog's back measured over 32" and the 32 coat was way too big so I'm returning and reordering the next size down which is a 28 and hope that isn't too small...there is no size 30
customer_reviews.author: Born to shop

customer_reviews.title: A very satisfied customer! Thank you Hurtta
customer_reviews.text: This is our fourth purchase of Hurtta brand winter dog coats. These coats keep our dogs warm and they are the first coat that our dogs have not been able to discard when outdoors. Finally a dog coat that does what it says it will. A very satisfied customer! Thank you Hurtta!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Bresin

customer_reviews.title: True to Size
customer_reviews.text: Awesome jacket. Easy on/off, fits well over chest and abdomen, have only had for 3 weeks, but seems to be very durable. Freedom of movement at shoulders and legs. My dog loves frisbee in the snow, gets wicked hang time and is not at all hindered by the jacket. Keeps her toasty warm in northeast winters.
customer_reviews.author: dmnork

customer_reviews.title: Love this coat for my black Lab for winter.
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my 9-year old lab, and after a lot of research, this was the one I chose and am really glad I did. I would have included a photo, but apparently did not save it on my computer, so I will have to take another, but excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: SDPT

customer_reviews.title: Bad straps
customer_reviews.text: It seems like really nicely made jacket. And then I noticed that the underbelly strap with the reflectors is sewn on backwards. And the elastic straps to keep the back part down are sewn too close together, so they give my dog a "wedgie" and she refuses to walk with them on (which I don't blame her at all). Overall the coat part is nice, but a fail on the sewn on straps.
customer_reviews.author: Mac92646

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product- cherry not true color.
customer_reviews.text: We just revived the parka in the mail today- which works out well as today is the first snow of the season. We are impressed with quality of this product, we have been searching for a quality winter coat that is waterproof and didn’t have Velcro. We got the cherry color and wanted to let others know that it is not true to color. It is very pink, we really don’t care what color our beagle wears - and he doesn’t seem to mind!
customer_reviews.author: Essie40

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dog jacket I have purchased. It fits great. A lot of manufactures misrepresent the size, not this. It fits perfectly. I love the adjustable back! It will keep my dog warm and toasty. Thanks Hurtta
customer_reviews.author: B. Rainke

customer_reviews.title: top quality and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: top quality and beautifully made coat. we will buy another one for our other dog. better made than some of my expensive coats, much thought went into the design and quality of material for this coat. I recommend anyone with a dog, large or small to consider this beautiful coat. My dog loves it, its easy to put on and its just a very nice looking product. thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ann nowak

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is worth every penny- fits my Boxer with her deep chest, perfectly. It’s very warm for the cold winter months in Wisconsin. I removed the leg straps which were too long on the shortest setting - and sewed loops on the sides with a belly band connector which does a much better job of keeping the jacket from blowing up her back.
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsin Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not the best design. Returned. Wouldn't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket. EXCEPT that this expensive dog coat has cheap, thin elastic that goes around the legs - I do not know ANY dog that wouldn't either wiggle out of those or eat them. Mine probably would've done both. Not worth the money, the design needs improvement. :/ Returned. Wouldn't purchase; there are better designs out there.
customer_reviews.author: LadyTatian

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the price, it will be the only coat you need for your dog.
customer_reviews.text: This dog coat is very well built and it allows the pup to move and jump. It is pricey but it’s worth it. Another thing I love is how adjustable the coat is around the neck the chest and tail (shorter length).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice coat, probably slightly overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice winter coat. Fit our Boston Terrier perfectly. I think it is probably slightly overpriced at 80$ though, hence 4/5 stars. I think 60$ would have been a good price target for this coat.
customer_reviews.author: tjc

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, I have a 167lb rottweiler who hates getting wet when it rains. This is the best fit I have been able to find for his size. I prefer it to the Ruffwear products I have bought before for him. Overall great quality- only thing I don't like are the hind leg straps. I don't use them size they kinda ride up too close to his butt (i.e might get covered in doggy poo). Other than that awesome product
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: It fits our Irish Setter perfectly with room to make adjustments. Due to allergies we have to keep her fur trimmed short. This is the perfect jacket for the morning walks when temperatures are in the 30’s - 40’s. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Good for cold, but not deep snow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coat for walking dogs in VERY cold weather, or just cold weather if your dog has short hair. It keeps their neck and belly covered, which is a good feature when temperatures are below 10 degrees F. It is not good in snow, though. Snow collects inside the coat, so the dog is getting cold and damp while wearing it. I have two very differently shaped dogs, and this is a problem for both. I am still searching for a good coat for my dogs to ear while running around in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: At last the right coat for shar pei
customer_reviews.text: One of the few warm winter coats that fits shar pei (size 20" long) because of the large head opening and ability to adjust the neck area. It's very easy to put and adjust to custom fit. The coat is comfortable for dog to wear and you can feel that dog is nicely warmed when coat is removed. My dog and I are very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: rainie

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm Dog Jacket!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Jacket for our French Bulldog. It keeps him warm in temperatures below or above 32 degrees.He loves it and it is very comfortable on him although he did not like straps in the back of jacket under his legs so he wears it without those straps!!
customer_reviews.author: Sotiris P.

product_meta.title: Hurtta Pet Collection Summit Parka for Dogs
product_meta.description:
Color:Cherry| Size:8 Inch

NOTICE - Truemark is a trusted seller of Hurtta brand products. Warranty will not be valid on any items purchased through other third party sellers. 

HURTTA SUMMIT PARKA

The Hurtta Summit parka is a completely revamped, highly functional version of the best-selling classic winter jacket. Recommended for active dogs and demanding use. The Jacket is designed not to slip and shift as your dog moves about. The highly technical winter jacket protects your dog's most important muscle groups, chest and the abdomen area. Quick to put on and take off, the jacket is particularly well suited for warming up the muscles of active dogs before or after training. The Parka has a waterproof yet breathable coating and high-visibility 3M reflectors so you dog can be seen at night. It also features an adjustable back length, belt and collar for a perfect fit. Attachment loops for the back legs help it to stay in place. The Hurtta Summit parka is a simple and efficient way to keep the dog's body temperature stable in cold weather. The jacket is designed to insulate short-haired dogs and dogs with no undercoat, preventing them from freezing in unfavorable weather. Hurtta has over 10 years of experience in the development of functional and durable clothing and accessories for dogs. All of their innovative products being designed in Finland for the everyday life of an active dog. Go enjoy the outdoors.
feature_bullets: NO TWO DOGS ARE THE SAME - Don’t guess on the size. Use the size chart along with the “Measuring Your Dog” size guide. The back length is the most important for apparel
USES -The Hurtta Summit parka is a simple and efficient way to keep the dog's body temperature stable in cold weather. It is as well suited for a quick stroll as it is a long hike
QUICK & EASY - Quick and easy to put on and take off, the Summit Parka does not need any legs lifted to be put on just one buckle around the waist
WATERPROOF - The Parka has a waterproof yet breathable Houndtex coating great for snow or light rain. High-visibility 3M reflectors are added so you dog can be seen at night
ADJUSTABLE - Features an adjustable back length, belt and collar to allow freedom of movement and a perfect fit

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
